meanings.definition: A small hard seed in a fruit
meanings.sent1: The apple had tiny pips inside.
meanings.sent2: She bit into the peach and accidentally crunched on a pip.
meanings.sent3: The orange pip rolled off the plate and onto the floor.
meanings.sent4: The watermelon seeds were like pips waiting to grow.
meanings.sent5: The cherry pip was so small, it was easy to miss.

meanings.definition: A series of small dots on a playing card
meanings.sent1: The card had red pips in the corner.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the black pips on the spades and clubs.
meanings.sent3: The pips on the card looked like a trail of ants.
meanings.sent4: The pips on the deck of cards seemed to dance when shuffled.
meanings.sent5: Counting the pips on the card helped him play the game.

meanings.definition: A high-pitched sound, especially of a bird
meanings.sent1: The bird's cheerful pip echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: She woke up to the sweet pips of the early birds.
meanings.sent3: The loud pip of the robin made her smile.
meanings.sent4: The pips of the songbirds filled the air with music.
meanings.sent5: The little bird's pip was a delightful morning greeting.

meanings.definition: To defeat someone in a game or competition
meanings.sent1: She managed to pips him in the final round.
meanings.sent2: He hoped to pip his opponent in the upcoming match.
meanings.sent3: The underdog team surprised everyone by pipping the champions.
meanings.sent4: In a surprising move, she pipped the reigning champion to win.
meanings.sent5: He trained hard to pip his rival and claim victory.
